channel.title: Squigglyo and his mighty story of win
channel.description:
Hey everyone.
A few months ago, those of you who's memories exceed my expectations my remember my mentioning i was writing a story.
Well, that story is all grown up now, and along with 2 other scripts, it has become a corner point of a website i am in production off.
Anyways, according to my critics, my story, while great, lacks substance and subtext. So, i place myself at the mercy of this might community and beseech thee to show me someone who is good at story writing to read over my script and assist by adding some subtext to the whole thing.
At the moment, i have just have pages of story. I believe the characters need to be developed more, in ways that don't necessarily effect the story. So, help me out people, show me someone who knows what they are talking about.
EDIT. Its 1am and im not drunk... So i may as well go sleep. Ill check back when im awake. So expect a reply in around T minus 8 hours....

item.title: Squigglyo and his mighty story of win
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

Reading books is my passion, and I spend great hours of the night reading/writing. If you’d like I can help you out by critiquing it more in-depth. You can ask the Graphics section, I’m pretty thorough.

Yeah, you give good C&C.

Read full topic
item.source: Squigglyo and his mighty story of win

item.title: Squigglyo and his mighty story of win
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

I would be interested in reading.
Story writing is one of the things i always seem to get 90-100% in in English…all the rest i fail so it balances out nicely.

Read full topic

item.title: Squigglyo and his mighty story of win
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

It wasn’t really in “paragraph form” as much as it was a script (as in John: hi, may I fuck you? Jane: Go right ahead.) But it was a good story. Can’t wait until you finish it all.

Read full topic
item.source: Squigglyo and his mighty story of win

item.title: Squigglyo and his mighty story of win
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

If you’re scared of plagiarism, delegate particular paragraphs to a number of people.

Read full topic
item.source: Squigglyo and his mighty story of win

item.title: Squigglyo and his mighty story of win
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Squigglyo:

well ive always been paranoid, so posting what could be my ticket out of this miserable existence in a public forum has me wondering if someone would beat me to making it, lol.

Oh fair enough, I didn’t realise it was a proper peice of literature, rather than an assignment etc. Good luck with it!

Read full topic
item.source: Squigglyo and his mighty story of win

item.title: Squigglyo and his mighty story of win
item.dc:creator: @Squigglyo Squigglyo
item.description:
@Squigglyo wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:6, topic:242054”]Wow what’s up with the sudden influx of people I haven’t seen in a while posting.

Squig, could probably post a copy of it in Reviews and Writing section. A few people post their school english coursework on there.[/quote]

well ive always been paranoid, so posting what could be my ticket out of this miserable existence in a public forum has me wondering if someone would beat me to making it, lol.

Read full topic
